column4: on the remote linux machine, when you attach to the samba share, username should be guest,
I guessed so. If I try with user 'guest' and no password, I get the result above. A fail message with 'failed to read shares'
password should also be guest.
that is a microsoft decision, not samba
Isn't there a way to set it up with no password ?
yes, but not an easy one.
I've been follwing various docs that attempt to show how to set up samba with passwordless access.
one step at a time.  Can you connect now?
I'm still getting the above failure message.
did you use my smb.conf file?
And the share isn't visible from my windows machine.
Sorry, I didn't see your paste. I got cut off from the nets for a few minutes.
http://pastebin.com/f7d0e936c
thanks. I'll give that a shot and get back to you in a sec...
Success!
Good.
I can now see the shares on my ubuntu machine from my windows machine
The windows machines should connect and not ask for passwords.
That is exactly what is happening. I will look over the file you've given me and look for where I went wrong.
Good luck.
I'm still not seeing the shares from my ubuntu machine. But I'll take it from here before I ask for more help. Thank you very much.
Brack10: which ubuntu are you using ?
